alert.note: Alert for Grant; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 9:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Grant and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Williamstown, Dry Ridge, Knoxville, Goforth, Williamstown Lake, Gardnersville, Gene Snyder Airport, Northcutt and Greenwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
